channel.title: Learn Java!
channel.description: Please stop posting applications! There currently is no official group anymore. At the time of creating this thread, I had not taking deep consideration into the fact that school and my job are really putting a burden on me when it comes to time evaluation. This group is just not possible for me to manage at the time; however, I will consider re-opening it whenever I can see a clear schedule ahead of me, but as for now, I do not have enough time, sorry.

item.title: Learn Java!
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I have updated the original post, so please read it before getting your hopes up.

Read full topic

item.title: Learn Java!
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

Why do you want to become a member of this group? I am interested in Java. I started out in RuneScape Private servers like a lot of people have, but I would like to expand my knowledge and actually know why and how the code works.

Do you have any prior experience in any type of programming? Just very basic RuneScape private server knowledge. I have also read/done the first couple of tutorials that Oracle offers.

If you acquire any knowledge in this group, which you should, what do you plan to use that knowledge for? Mainly just write programs that will help me along with basically anything. Right now I’m in Pre-Calculus in College and I would like to design certain calculators to perform different tasks to help me get the answer faster and to also require me to know each formular enough to turn it into a program. (Good way to study)

Oh, and by the way, I sent you my skype name through a private message.

Read full topic

item.title: Learn Java!
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:113, topic:464483”][quote author=Host Gushers link=topic=568491.msg4201188#msg4201188 date=1358218077]
The whole time ive been in this so called “group” i havent learned anything :l Hopefully you can take more time out to teach people stuff.
[/quote]

In this community, you pretty much have to teach and learn on your own. You really shouldn’t be learning from anyone in this community; myself included. You’ll be a lot better off if you educate yourself.[/quote]

you’ve been completely wrong in 90% of your posts since you got here

Read full topic

item.title: Learn Java!
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

What is your Skype name? (You may private message me this)
I’ll pm you it if I get accepted.

Why do you want to become a member of this group?
I want to learn, the more I know the better. I want to work as a programmer in a few years, preferably in the games sector. I’ve always had an interest in programming.
Do you have any prior experience in any type of programming?
Java
I have a level six qualification in Java programming. Doing Java again at the same level atm at college as I’ve got to do it in order to achieve my foundation degree in computing. Level 6 is one of the entry requirements for the first year of uni but compared to what you see on RSPS its nothing. We’ve only been told specific things that are related to our course. If it doesn’t improve our grade, we don’t get taught it sort’ve basis so I’m pretty noobie I’d say.
If you acquire any knowledge in this group, which you should, what do you plan to use that knowledge for?
Improve my education grades, mess around with RSPS - maybe make a few releases, hopefully use it in a future job. The way the OP is worded it seems like its hoped that people will share info that has been learned which I have no problems with.

Read full topic

item.title: Learn Java!
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:116, topic:464483”]Feel free to tell me to love off. Don’t hold back. Type until your fingers hurt. Inform me of how much I irritate you. Type your nonsense until you begin to weep.
That feeds me.

Chances are, I’ll skim most of it and ill continue on my happy way.

On-topic: I just don’t want you blind folk… well, leading the blind.
I’ve seen how damaging it is.[/quote]
Continue on your happy way with your ridiculous analogy.

Read full topic

item.title: Learn Java!
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:108, topic:464483”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=568491.msg4197703#msg4197703 date=1357763975]

From what I’ve have seen, none of you should be teaching anyone.

Didn’t know you’ve ‘seen’ anything. I never saw you in the group.
[/quote]

Please inform me of why you think you’re qualified to be teaching anyone.
I’d love to know your experience level. Include education or describe previous work.[/quote]
At no point have I ever mentioned myself teaching anyone in this group. The terms “teach”, “teaching”, or “taught” do not appear on my original post or on the first page for that matter. It seems you are confused due to the previous flame war between other members ridiculing something quite related to what you have mentioned. I currently do not and never will teach someone professionally, simply because I’m not in this world to teach, but to learn.

Read full topic

item.title: Learn Java!
item.dc:creator: @Doobage Doobage
item.description:
@Doobage wrote:

What is your Skype name? (You may private message me this)
DV32692

Why do you want to become a member of this group?
To help boost up my knowledge of java and possibly help others with coding their RSPS with ideas or helpful codes.

Do you have any prior experience in any type of programming?
Java - since 2007
some PHP coding <- Have done web design and made my own sites from scratch
some usage of MYSQL and MSSQL database <- Aion WoW GunZ the Duel databases
XML <- GunZ the Duel, Approx. 4 years.

If you acquire any knowledge in this group, which you should, what do you plan to use that knowledge for?
Making my Pserver better as well as anyone else who may need the help if they are at least willing to help themselves first.

Read full topic
